newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Explorers Index down in mixed week.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Explorers Index down in mixed week.

text.p: Stockbroker Eyres Reed Ltd said its Australian Explorers Index fell 17.10 points or 0.62 percent last week. The All Ordinaries index rose 2.35 percent.
Aug 23 Aug 16 pct 1 Month 1 Year pct
NOTE: The explorers index (base 500, March 1992) tracks the performance of 88 small capitalisation exploration companies.
"The Eyres Reed Explorers Index had a mixed week with many small runners failing to follow through and hold their gains by week's end," Eyres Reed analyst Glen Colgan said in a commentary.
Falls outnumbered rises five to four.

Diamin Resources NL rose 0.5 cents to 4.3 cents as the company prepares to drill a possible kimberlite pipe in the Mad Gap project northwest of Halls Creek in the Kimberley region of Western Australia, Julia Mines NL edged up 1.5 cents to 18 cents after announcing several high grade RC drill intercepts from its Lady Irene prospect, North Menzies, WA, and Alliance Gold Mines NL responded positively to the increase in gold resources at its Union Hill North prospect, up 3.0 cents to 19.5 cents.

Other strong performances included Troy Resources NL up 8.0 cents to 60 cents, Sipa Resources Internationl NL up 2.0 cents to 24 cents, Roebuck Resources NL off recent lows, up 7.0 cents to 55 cents, and Central Bore Nickel NL up 0.9 cents to 4.2 cents after trading as high as 4.7 cents.

Planned merger partners General Gold Resources NL and Great Southern Mines NL both lost ground post their merger announcement. General Gold fell 4.0 cents to 53 cents and Great Southern fell 15 cents to 95 cents.

Other falls included Golden Tiger Resources NL , down 5.0 cents to 90 cents, Noble Resources NL off 1.5 cents to 7.5 cents, Amalg Resources NL off 5.5 cents to 47.5 cents and Venture Exploration NL, off 4.0 cents to 24 cents.
